comment: Goat professor. Work is not difficult and stakes are low.
rating_tags: Graded by few things

comment: I mean, if you're taking this course just because you actually have to, he's a pretty good choice in that regard. Just 8 quizzes for the entire semester and an extra credit essay.

Only gives 8 quizzes for the entire course. Is very easy overall since all answers can be found online despite what he thinks. Only offers one make up and no more, if you miss 2+ quizzes you may be cooked. Only extra credit is an essay. Not hard, but super annoying to work with.
If you have to take American Gov, TAKE HIM!! easiest professor ever! he has 8 quizzes every other week and you their is no lockdown or camera so use it to your own advantage... easiest class ever.
His class is ridiculously easy, you can look up everything and you will be fine. Just make sure you don't miss any quizzes or tests, because he is very unforgiving when it comes to that.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: Mr. Ellis is a very easy professor in an online course. All you have to do is the 8 quizzes on time (He gives you two weeks) and it's an easy A. He doesn't make you do anything besides the quizzes, and they aren't on the lockdown browser either.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Easygoing. They only give eight quizzes throughout the semester

I took his class as a summer online class. There were 8 quizzes that every question is from a test bank that is easy to find online. The class is a waste of money and time, and it is apparent that he does not care about making the course worthwhile for his students. Quizzes due at noon, which is different, and posts rude announcements constantly.

I do not like government, so I am pretty biased. This class was not bad at all just boring and if you need an easy gen ed take this. Some quizzes were harder than others, but then again I am not passionate about this subject at all. He does offer an extra credit essay that replaces the lowest test grade.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Highly recommend taking this online class its super easy. Powerpoints along with short videos are posted, but the quiz every 2 weeks is really easy.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I take his pols 1101 class and it is so easy. it's a quiz for two modules due every two weeks. Super easy I suggest!

Your grade is made up 8 Quizzes which course material does a great job of covering, so no unexpected surprises. You'll also have an extra credit assignment which is a 3pg essay. I know it sounds like a lot but it isn't once you see the guidelines. I fumbled the bag and missed 1 quiz and the extra credit. Still walked away with a B+. Hope this helps
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: This class is very straight-forward and easy! It's only eight quizzes so make you do well and you make a A or B. Simple! Additionally, he gives a extra credit essay to replace your lowest quiz.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Ellis is a great online professor. Grade is comprised of 8 tests, one for each unit, every two weeks (no lockdown, open note). He responds to emails fairly fast and provides an extra credit essay that will replace your lowest test score. Easy A.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Online Savvy

comment: Prof Ellis is the most fair prof ever. His class is graded on 4 tests (open book, open notes, open ppts) and participation. His class is lecture heavy but his lectures are pretty entertaining and relevant. He gives an alt assignment in case you miss a test and gives u a week to take tests. He cracks a joke occasionally, honestly a great guy. Easy A
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: He's a very chill and understanding professor. It was a night class, so he always let out early. There were only five grades for the whole semester (4 tests and a class participation grade) and there was also an extra credit opportunity to make up for your lowest grade. The tests are open note, open book. Overall, great class. Take this guy.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is a very knowledgeable professor, he does funny impression. As long as you show up to class, read the textbook and take you test on time, you will be fine. 4 test (online, open book and notes). It is impossible to fail his class. Strongly recommened
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Professor Ellis was my favorite teacher this semester. He often relays real life situations into his lectures. His class is also quite easy as long as you pay attention and put in the normal effort for a class. He will say to you on the first day, Do what you know youre supposed to do, and you will be fine. You will have no problem making an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Test heavy

comment: 5 tests- open book and notes. That is all that is graded. He posted lecture videos for the tests but they are pretty simple. I mainly used my textbook for the tests bc lectures are straight from it. Seems like a cool guy. I dont actually know him though. Take him if you want an A!
rating_tags: Test heavy--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Lecture heavy but all tests online at home (not lockdown + is open book). Must read textbooks because he will call to the front of the class to answer questions. Very smart professor (a lawyer by day I believe). Does a very accurate + hilarious Trump impression. Discusses opinions from both sides.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I would highly be against taking Professor Ellis. If you have a family emergency and can't take a test/exam he will not care and will let you know in a very cold manner. The way the class is structured gives the impression that he just put up a few powerpoints and checked out afterwards. Also, if you don't do well on an assignment you're screwed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Had him spring 2019 in his 8pm class. The class was super easy. The tests were take home. All he wanted was for us to read the chapters before class & have the book with us (ebook was ok). He will call on you to ask a question about the chapter though, and could dock your attendance if you have no clue or no book. Easy online current event quizzes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Steven Ellis was a fine teacher until Covid happened. After we stopped meeting in person he completely stopped teaching and didn't round up grades. During a normal semester expect to have to read the full textbook. He also does Kahoot's which are pretty fun. He does randomly call on students for credit so beware of that.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This is a great add-on 8:00 p.m. class. Professor Ellis is very intelligent, knowledgeable and has a sense of humor, brings insights form his line of work. He represents opinions of both sides and doesnt venture out into personal political preferences. He welcomes questions and makes class engaging.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Read the textbook and that's it. He'll call you up randomly to see if people read the chapter or not. There are four exams and two quizzes, they're taken online and at home. Do the work and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: If you have a chance to take him as a professor, please do! As long as you read the chapters and participate in class you will get an A. We only had 2 exams and 4 current events quizzes all online with more than enough time to get them done. Trust me, it's way harder to fail than to pass.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: With the way the course is set up and how easy it is, the only way you will fail is by NOT showing up. (Skip 4+ Unexcused I think is a guaranteed F) HOWEVER this class is the easiest A of your life as long as you respect his expectations and participate. Also read the textbook or have some general knowledge or be prepared to get called out on it..
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: 2 exams and 4 current events quizzes (online without lockdown), as well as participation credit. Very simple class, exams were based on textbook material and quizzes were based on news headlines that can be found with a quick google search. Lectures were dull, but he's a funny guy and tries to relate class material to the real world. Easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: If you show up , you have no excuse to fail this class. Tests are take home and he also gives high weighted quizzes which are online. Its harder to get a B in this class than an A.

All his tests are take-home tests. A very easy A. His teaching method is very modern. He tries not to lecture very much and lets the students discuss ideas with each other. He has great engaging class activities and does a lot of group work. I never felt tempted to skip his class. He actually makes class fun and educational. Book not needed.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Show up and READ THE TEXTBOOK and you will get an A. Don't worry about Quiz and Test ;) You will fail if you don't show up and if you have a bad attitude

He doesn't seem like the warm/fuzzy type but he's very kind. He is pretty lecture heavy but these lectures are good to go through for the test and his test aren't hard. Everything can be found in the book. He has an attendance policy so only miss a few classes. You have two fun group projects but a bad group is the worst part. I loved this class
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Professor Ellis was great! Its tough being in an 8pm class but he makes it worth it. His expert background makes the learning objects interesting. Grading was completely fair. Participate, ask questions, and pay attention and you'll get an A!
rating_tags: Respected--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Ellis brought some really unique qualities to the table. He teaches using his profession in law to show examples of why knowledge of government is important. He is laid back, but seeks class participation. He is motivated, involved, well-spoken, and has the gift of intelligence. If you are interested and want to learn, you'll do well.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: You really don't have to worry about grades in his class. Just show up and do the work and you already passed. I wasn't even interested in this course but ended up learning so much, plus it makes it applicable to real life. Definitely advise anyone to take his class. Oh he's kinda though but don't just take it personal and you'll be fine
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Can get kind of snippy if you ask him a question. Very well spoken and always carried himself well. 5 grades made up of 2 tests, 2 GROUP projects, and 1 paper. Very knowledgeable. Only thing is hes kind of rude if approaching for clarification.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Ellis is very intelligent and unlike many professors, he has you apply the knowledge that you have acquired. I learned a lot from his class and would definitely take him again.
rating_tags: Respected--Inspirational--Caring

comment: Ellis is great! You have only four tests, all of which are open book/take home if the class generally participates in class. He also does a really great Trump impression. The only downside is that at the beginning of the year you HAVE TO READ THE BOOK. He will call you up to the podium and ask you questions about the chapter in front of the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: There were only 4 tests for this course, and 2 were open note/book and the others weren't. This class was easy but the lectures are hard to sit through.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mr. Ellis is amazing! The lectures are interesting and easy to follow. The tests are open book. If you can't pass them then you have a problem. The study guides are helpful and you can use them on the tests. It is impossible to fail the tests! He provides you with everything to perform well in the class. It's just up to you to use it! TAKE HIM!!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Don't skip class! He will call you out on it and he drops your grade two points each time you miss. Tests are open book for the first two exams but not the third or the final.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS
